notes.text:
An update for openvswitch is now available in Fast Datapath for Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7.

Red Hat Product Security has rated this update as having a security impact of Moderate. A Common Vulnerability Scoring System (CVSS) base score, which gives a detailed severity rating, is available for each vulnerability from the CVE link(s) in the References section.
notes.title: Topic

notes.text:
Open vSwitch provides standard network bridging functions and support for the OpenFlow protocol for remote per-flow control of traffic.

Security Fix(es):

* dpdk: librte_vhost Interger overflow in vhost_user_set_log_base() (CVE-2020-10722)

* dpdk: librte_vhost Integer truncation in vhost_user_check_and_alloc_queue_pair() (CVE-2020-10723)

For more details about the security issue(s), including the impact, a CVSS score, acknowledgments, and other related information, refer to the CVE page(s) listed in the References section.

Bug Fix(es):

* OVS causing high pings and latency inside guest VM when an active DPDK port fails (BZ#1822198)

* SEGV after recirculation in batch processing in vswitchd 2.9.0 (BZ#1826886)
notes.title: Details

notes.text: A vulnerability was found in DPDK versions 18.05 and above. A missing check for an integer overflow in vhost_user_set_log_base() could result in a smaller memory map than requested, possibly allowing memory corruption.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: dpdk: librte_vhost Integer overflow in vhost_user_set_log_base()
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: This issue did not affect the versions of Ceph as shipped with Red Hat Ceph Storage 3 and 4, as they did not include support for DPDK.
notes.title: Statement

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

remediations.details:
For details on how to apply this update, which includes the changes described in this advisory, refer to:

https://access.redhat.com/articles/11258

vulnerabilities.title: dpdk: librte_vhost Integer overflow in vhost_user_set_log_base()

notes.text: A memory corruption issue was found in DPDK versions 17.05 and above. This flaw is caused by an integer truncation on the index of a payload. Under certain circumstances, the index (a UInt) is copied and truncated into a uint16, which can lead to out of bound indexing and possible memory corruption.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: dpdk: librte_vhost Integer truncation in vhost_user_check_and_alloc_queue_pair()
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: This issue did not affect the versions of Ceph as shipped with Red Hat Ceph Storage 3 and 4, as they did not include support for DPDK.
notes.title: Statement

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

For details on how to apply this update, which includes the changes described in this advisory, refer to:

https://access.redhat.com/articles/11258
